conclusion: Analyze forces and apply conservation of momentum and energy to determine velocities after collision.
Initial conditions: P and Q are at rest, friction details, no kinetic energy loss in collision.
Collision is elastic, kinetic energy and momentum are conserved.
Total kinetic energy before collision equals total kinetic energy after collision.
Total momentum before collision equals total momentum after collision.
From kinetic energy conservation: 16v_Q1^2 = 0, so v_Q1 = 0.
